comments.body: Please use a constant: defaultProtobufContentType instead

Just for testing purposes - I can use a completely arbitrary one here
instead.

On Wed, Mar 30, 2016 at 5:57 PM, Wojciech Tyczynski <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> In pkg/runtime/serializer/protobuf/protobuf_test.go
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/20377#discussion_r57971034
> :
> 
> > +
> > +func (d *testBufferedMarshalable) Marshal() ([]byte, error) {
> > -   return nil, fmt.Errorf("not invokable")
> >   +}
> >   +
> >   +func (d *testBufferedMarshalable) MarshalTo(data []byte) (int, error) {
> > -   copy(data, d.data)
> > -   return len(d.data), d.err
> >   +}
> >   +
> >   +func (d *testBufferedMarshalable) Size() int {
> > -   return len(d.data)
> >   +}
> >   +
> >   +func TestRecognize(t *testing.T) {
> > -   s := protobuf.NewSerializer(nil, nil, "application/protobuf")
> 
> Please use a constant: defaultProtobufContentType instead
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/20377/files/d7a1e247a94bf7eef7f493d96d603644e664d365#r57971034
I think it's stilghtly misleading, but well, we can leave it :)
Please use a constant: defaultProtobufContentType instead

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +156,160 @@
	for i, test := range testCases {
		s := protobuf.NewSerializer(nil, nil, "application/protobuf")
		data, err := runtime.Encode(s, test.obj)
